intro: Licania adolphoduckei, commonly known as the Adolpho Ducke's licania, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to the Amazon rainforest, primarily found in Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in understory layers of dense tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
